citation.article-title: New aerobic ammonium-dependent obligately oxalotrophic bacteria: description of Ammoniphilus oxalaticus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Ammoniphilus oxalivorans gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Ammoniphilus oxalivorans sp. nov.
Ammoniphilus oxalivorans (O.xa.li.vo'rans. M. L. neut. n. oxalatum oxalate; L. part. pres. vorans eating; M.L. adj. oxalivorans oxalate-eating)
Straight short or long slightly curved rods (1.1-1.4 μm x 0.7-1.1 μm in size which occur singly, in pairs, in short or long chains.
Endospores are oval, centrally or subterminally formed, in non-swollen or slightly swollen sporangia.
On agar medium (4-8 d) colonies are white, convex, circular form with entire margin and smooth surface, up to 2mm in diameter.
Poor growth occurs at 0.03-0.6 M NH4+ while no growth occurs at ≤0.02 M NH4+.
Obligate oxalotroph.
Growth occurs up to 100 g ammonium oxalate l-1, with good growth in 5-60 g ammonium oxalate -1.
No growth occurs in ≤4 g ammonium oxalate l-1, with glyoxylate or other organic acids, sugars or alcohols, or on mixtures of formate and glyoxylate or methanol and glyoxylate.
Mesophilic, growth occurs at 20-38°C, with an optimum of 28-30°C.
The pH range for growth is 6.8-9.5.
Tolerant to 5% NaCl.
Starch and gelatin are hydrolysed.
H2S formed from cysteine but not from thiosulfate.
Nitrates, nitrites or urea are not utilized as the sole nitrogen sources.
No reduction of nitrate to nitrite or N2; no requirement for vitamins; no production of urease and indole.
The major cellular fatty acids are 12-methyl tetradecanoic (37%), cis-hexadec-9-enoic (13%) and hexadecanoic acids (26-28%).
The G+C content of the DNA is 42 mol%.

The type strain RAOx-FS was isolated from the rhizosphere of sorrel (Rumex acetosa) and is deposited in the DSMZ as strain DSM 11537 and in the University of Helsinki HAMBI Collection as strain HAMBI 2284.
The properties of this strain are the same as the properties described above for the species.
